014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.freebuilder;
015
016import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
017import java.lang.invoke.MethodType;
018import java.util.Arrays;
019import java.util.function.Supplier;
020
021import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.exceptions.Unchecked;
024import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.internal.BuilderPojoPropertiesFactory;
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.internal.PojoPropertiesFactory;
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.internal.PojoTypes;
027import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta;
028
029/**
030 * Configures support for an <a href="https://freebuilder.inferred.org">FreeBuilder</a> generated {@code Builder)} value type.
031 */
032@Beta
033public class JdbiFreeBuilders implements JdbiConfig<JdbiFreeBuilders> {
034    private ConfigRegistry registry;
035
036    public JdbiFreeBuilders() {}
037
038    @Override
039    public void setRegistry(ConfigRegistry registry) {
040        this.registry = registry;
041    }
042
043    @Override
044    public JdbiFreeBuilders createCopy() {
045        return new JdbiFreeBuilders();
046    }
047
048    /**
049     * Register bean arguments and row mapping for a {@code Freebuilder} value class, expecting the default generated class and builder names.
050     * @param spec the specification interface of abstract class
051     * @param <S> the specification class
052     * @return a plugin that configures type mapping for the given class
053     */
054    public <S> JdbiFreeBuilders registerFreeBuilder(Class<S> spec) {
055        final Class<? extends S> impl = valueClass(spec);
056        return registerFreeBuilder(spec, impl, builderConstructor(spec));
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * Convenience method for registering many freebuilder types.
061     * @see #registerFreeBuilder(Class)
062     */
063    public JdbiFreeBuilders registerFreeBuilder(Class<?>... specs) {
064        return registerFreeBuilder(Arrays.asList(specs));
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Convenience method for registering many freebuilder types.
069     * @see #registerFreeBuilder(Class)
070     */
071    public JdbiFreeBuilders registerFreeBuilder(Iterable<Class<?>> specs) {
072        specs.forEach(this::registerFreeBuilder);
073        return this;
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Register bean arguments and row mapping for a {@code FreeBuilder} value class, using a supplied implementation and constructor.
078     * @param spec the specification interface or abstract class
079     * @param impl the generated value class
080     * @param builderConstructor a supplier of new Builder instances
081     * @param <S> the specification class
082     * @param <I> the generated value class
083     * @return a plugin that configures type mapping for the given class
084     */
085    public <S, I extends S> JdbiFreeBuilders registerFreeBuilder(Class<S> spec, Class<I> impl, Supplier<?> builderConstructor) {
086        return register(spec, impl, BuilderPojoPropertiesFactory.builder(spec, builderConstructor));
087    }
088
089    private <S> JdbiFreeBuilders register(Class<S> spec, Class<? extends S> impl, PojoPropertiesFactory factory) {
090        registry.get(PojoTypes.class).register(spec, factory).register(impl, factory);
091        return this;
092    }
093
094    private <S> Class<? extends S> valueClass(Class<S> spec) {
095        final String valueName;
096        if (spec.getEnclosingClass() == null) {
097            valueName = spec.getPackage().getName() + "." + spec.getSimpleName() + "_" + "Builder" + "$" + "Value";
098        } else {
099            String enclosingName = spec.getEnclosingClass().getSimpleName();
100            valueName = spec.getPackage().getName() + "." + enclosingName + "_" + spec.getSimpleName() + "_" + "Builder" + "$" + "Value";
101        }
102        try {
103            return Class.forName(valueName).asSubclass(spec);
104        } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
105            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Couldn't locate value class " + valueName, e);
106        }
107    }
108
109    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
110    private <S> Supplier<?> builderConstructor(Class<S> spec) {
111        final Class builderClass = builderClass(spec);
112        try {
113            return (Supplier<S>) Unchecked.supplier(
114                MethodHandles
115                    .lookup()
116                    .findConstructor(builderClass, MethodType.methodType(void.class))::invoke);
117        } catch (ReflectiveOperationException e) {
118            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Couldn't find public constructor of " + spec, e);
119        }
120    }
121
122    private <S> Class builderClass(Class<S> spec) {
123        final String builderName;
124        if (spec.getEnclosingClass() == null) {
125            builderName = spec.getPackage().getName() + "." + spec.getSimpleName() + "$" + "Builder";
126        } else {
127            String enclosingName = spec.getEnclosingClass().getSimpleName();
128            builderName = spec.getPackage().getName() + "." + enclosingName + "$" + spec.getSimpleName() + "$" + "Builder";
129        }
130
131        try {
132            return Class.forName(builderName);
133        } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
134            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Couldn't locate builder class " + builderName, e);
135        }
136    }
137}
